episodes.description: The guys hire Dee's friend, Terrell to promote the bar.  Meanwhile, Charlie tries to prove that he is not a racist.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Racist

episodes.description: A girl from Charlie's past reveals they have a child together.  Mac sees the benefits in being a pro-life advocate, while Dennis uses an abortion rally to meet women.
episodes.title: Charlie Wants an Abortion

episodes.description: After reminiscing about high school, the guys conclude that it would be a public service if they allowed teens to drink in the bar, thus providing a safe and controlled environment for teens to party. Feeling that she missed out on a lot as a teenager due to having to wear a brace for her scoliosis, Dee begins dating a high school jock.
episodes.title: Underage Drinking: A National Concern

episodes.description: After discovering that he might have cancer, Mac and Dennis attempt to find a woman who will sleep with Charlie.  In the midst of their search, Mac falls in love with a transsexual he meets at the bar named Carmen.  Overwhelmed by the extra workload that she had to take on since Charlie has taken a leave of absence, Dee tries to get Dennis to hire a recently out of work actress friend to help out.
episodes.title: Charlie Has Cancer

episodes.description: The guys buy a gun after the bar's safe is stolen.
episodes.title: Gun Fever

episodes.description: Mac and Dennis befriend a patron found dead at their bar in order to win the affection of his granddaughter.
episodes.title: The Gang Finds A Dead Guy

episodes.description: Charlie and Mac's old high school gym teacher is accused of molestation.
episodes.title: Charlie Got Molested

episodes.description: An accident that puts Charlie in a wheelchair opens up a window of possibilities for the gang. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee’s estranged father reenters their life in hopes of starting anew with his children and soon discovers that he enjoys the lifestyle of their friends.
episodes.title: Charlie Gets Crippled

episodes.description: When the gang learns that they are in danger of losing their bar due to a zoning mishap, they resort to some outlandish and extreme methods to prevent that from happening. Meanwhile, Frank isn’t too happy when his wife returns to town.
episodes.title: The Gang Goes Jihad

episodes.description: After quitting their job due to Frank's continuing interference, Dennis and Dee decide to seek alternative income by going on welfare. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie must now bear the consequences of their friends’ departures from the business.
episodes.title: Dennis and Dee Go on Welfare

episodes.description: Barbara hooks up with Mac to make Frank jealous, which leads to retaliation from Dennis.
episodes.title: Mac Bangs Dennis' Mom

episodes.description: Frank runs into an old adversary at the gym when he begins teaching Dee to box after she was robbed. Hoping to make some extra money on the side, Mac and Dennis make preparations for Charlie to compete in an underground street fighting match.
episodes.title: Hundred Dollar Baby

episodes.description: After being arrested for arson the gang is sentenced to do community service. Frank makes an effort to connect more with Dennis. Meanwhile, Charlie is also ordered to attend AA where he makes a startling discovery that might be beneficial in his ongoing quest to hook up with the Waitress.
episodes.title: The Gang Gives Back

episodes.description: Mac and Dee become uncomfortable when the rest of the guys decide to make some extra money by exploiting the similarities between a water stain and the Virgin Mary. A reunion with someone from the past, stirs up forbidden feelings within Dee.
episodes.title: The Gang Exploits A Miracle

episodes.description: Driven by Frank's insight into the world of politics, Dennis pursues a political career by running for office.
episodes.title: The Gang Runs for Office

episodes.description: Dennis and Mac make a decision to take away all rules concerning moral and behavioral etiquette at Paddy's after an argument about the Constitution. Frank uses the decision and it's following consequences to his own gain. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to convey his love for America by protesting while Dee attempts to reaffirm her goal of being an actress.
episodes.title: Charlie Goes America All Over Everybody's Ass

episodes.description: Dee receives e-mails from a stranger claiming to be her and Dennis' real father. Meanwhile, Mac decides to visit his father who is in prison.
episodes.title: Dennis and Dee Get a New Dad

episodes.description: Dennis joins up with an environmentalist group, but his altruistic intentions quickly sour when he's snubbed by the activists. Dee and Mac decide to raise a baby they find in the dumpster, but quickly find out that it's not nearly as fun as they thought it would be, and Frank and Charlie take the concept of recycling a bit too far.
episodes.title: The Gang Finds A Dumpster Baby

episodes.description: Mac, Dennis and Dee try out for the Philadelphia Eagles.  Also interested in becoming an Eagle is Liam and Ryan McPoyle's brother, Doyle.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Invincible

episodes.description: After Barbara's death, Dee and Frank are unhappy to learn that she left them both out of the will, while Dennis inherits the mansion which he plans to turn into a party pad.
episodes.title: Dennis and Dee's Mom Is Dead

episodes.description: The McPoyles hold the entire gang hostage at Paddys while Frank is busy searching for his will in the air ducts.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Held Hostage

episodes.description: Dee is shocked to learn that an overweight social outcast from her High School has become a rich and skinny fashion designer.
episodes.title: The Aluminum Monster vs. Fatty Magoo

episodes.description: A Korean restaurant owner threatens to get Paddy's kicked off the route for the city's annual pub crawl. The gang's response: War.
episodes.title: The Gang Solves the North Korea Situation

episodes.description: The gang agrees to sell Paddys when they get an offer that is too good to refuse, but it forces the bar's non-partners, Dee and Charlie to find new jobs.
episodes.title: The Gang Sells Out

episodes.description: Mac teams up with Frank and Charlie to create a public access newscast after he misses his chance at fame in the news. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee try to make it big in the club scene.
episodes.title: Frank Sets Sweet Dee On Fire

episodes.description: Dee gets involved with a famous local rapper who might be mentally challenged, and whose success inspires the rest of the gang to start a band.
episodes.title: Sweet Dee's Dating a Retarded Person

episodes.description: After Mac arrives to the bar with scratches on his neck and exhibiting strange behavior, Frank comes to the conclusion that he is the serial killer terrorizing young women in Philadelphia. Frank sets out with his trusty chainsaw and a doubtful Charlie to find evidence to implicate Mac in the murders. In search of another suspect, Dennis and Dee do a little role-playing in order to help themselves better understand who they might be dealing with.
episodes.title: Mac Is a Serial Killer

episodes.description: When Dennis is mistaken for a recently released child molester, he is more bothered by the fact that the guy is overweight rather than him being a sex offender.  Meanwhile, Mac tries once again to bond with his ex-con father, who shows an interest in Dee.
episodes.title: Dennis Looks Like a Registered Sex Offender

episodes.description: After stumbling upon a kilo of cocaine, the gang is forced to pay off a $25,000 debt to the mob. Mac becomes a mob informant, while Frank pimps out Dennis as an escort at the local country club. Charlie stumbles upon an opportunity to sell illegal narcotics.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 1

episodes.description: While paying off their debt to the mob, Charlie and Dee try to find a way to make fake cocaine in order to fool them, while Dennis ranks in thousands of dollars being pimped out at the local country club. Mac realizes his position as a mob informant isn't being utilized to its full potential.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 2

episodes.description: Mac and Dee become vigilantes in order to remove the homeless from their neighborhood, while Frank and Dennis impersonate police officers.
episodes.title: Bums: Making a Mess All Over the City

episodes.description: In the season finale, Charlie accidentally puts Paddy's up as a prize for a dance marathon, which prompts the gang to enter the competition in order to save their bar.
episodes.title: The Gang Dances Their Asses Off

episodes.description: Charlie and Dee have been stealing Frank's delicious meats, so Frank leaves out human meat to get back at them. Driven by their cannibalistic needs, Charlie and Dee go in search of human flesh. Mac and Dennis harass Frank for hunting defenseless animals and think it would be much more badass to hunt something that could fight back ... like a human.
episodes.title: Mac and Dennis: Manhunters

episodes.description: Charlie, Mac, and Dennis formulate a plan to take advantage of the rising gas prices. By purchasing excess amounts now, they can sell it in the future and profit. As usual, things don't go as planned. Dee is also out to make money when she learns that Bruce is going to give the family fortune to a Muslim cultural center. She and Frank try to stop him and get the cash for themselves.
episodes.title: The Gang Solves the Gas Crisis

episodes.description: Due to the gang's latest "business expenses," Paddy's is in dire need of money. Frank buys a billboard to advertise the bar, but Dee decides to create a viral video to post on YouTube for promotion. Charlie quickly joins her, leaving Frank and Mac to hold a contest for some hot models to feature on the billboard. Naturally, Dennis joins the competition to prove his worth.
episodes.title: America’s Next Top Paddy’s Billboard Model Contest

episodes.description: Charlie finds out that the waitress has been seeing someone. He calls on Mac, his so-called best friend, to find out more information about the guy and to beat him up. However, it turns out that Mac is the guy the waitress has supposedly been seeing. Dennis, heartbroken that he's not Charlie's best friend, tries to win him over.
episodes.title: Mac’s Banging the Waitress

episodes.description: Part 1 of 2. Mac and Charlie fake their deaths to avoid the wrath of Mac's father who was released from prison and is out for vengeance.
episodes.title: Mac and Charlie Die: Part One

episodes.description: Part 2 of 2. Dennis, Frank, and Dee find unique ways of coping with the apparent loss of their friends.
episodes.title: Mac and Charlie Die: Part Two

episodes.description: Charlie and Frank awake to find poop in their bed. Neither will confess to being the owner, so they, Mac, and Dennis try to scientifically deduce who dropped the deuce. Dee wants to do something a bit more sophisticated, so she invites the waitress and Artemis to a girls' night out.
episodes.title: Who Pooped the Bed?

episodes.description: A newspaper critic is kidnapped by the gang after he calls Paddy's pub the worst bar in Philadelphia.
episodes.title: Paddy’s Pub: The Worst Bar in Philadelphia

episodes.description: After discovering Dennis' erotic memoir, Mac and Frank attempt to make some money off of it. Meanwhile, Dee and Charlie decide to spend a day in each other's shoes.
episodes.title: Dennis Reynolds: An Erotic Life

episodes.description: After Dee suffers a heart attack, she and Dennis try to live a healthier lifestyle. Meanwhile, Charlie and Mac take corporate jobs to get health insurance.
episodes.title: Sweet Dee Has a Heart Attack

episodes.description: The gang fudge history by claiming that Paddy's Pub was responsible for cracking the Liberty Bell in an attempt to turn their dive into a Philadelphia landmark.
episodes.title: The Gang Cracks the Liberty Bell

episodes.description: Hoping to make their own dreams come true, the gang sets out to give an unexpected family an extreme home makeover.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Extreme: Home Makeover Edition

episodes.description: In the season finale, Charlie gets the gang to help him put together a rock opera based on his song "Nightman."
episodes.title: The Nightman Cometh

episodes.description: Dennis, Mac, and Frank go into real estate, while Dee sets out to be a surrogate for a wealthy couple. Charlie gets into it with an attorney over the law.
episodes.title: The Gang Exploits the Mortgage Crisis

episodes.description: The gang tries to expand their horizons by going on a road trip to the Grand Canyon.
episodes.title: The Gang Hits the Road

episodes.description: With a shantytown taking shape outside, Mac and Dennis try to keep Paddy's going in tough times. Meanwhile, Frank and Dee start a family business.
episodes.title: The Great Recession

episodes.description: Frank's behavior is more bizarre than usual---so bizarre that even the gang notice---so they decide to stage an intervention.
episodes.title: The Gang Gives Frank an Intervention

episodes.description: The waitress is getting married, Dee is jealous that she's beating her to the altar, so she tries to derail the wedding.
episodes.title: The Waitress Is Getting Married

episodes.description: The gang describes the trials and tribulations they went through, during game five of the World Series, in hopes the judge will clear them of all the citations they received.
episodes.title: The World Series Defense

episodes.description: The gang puts together a wrestling show for returning troops. Meanwhile, Dee finally meets the soldier that she has been communicating with over the internet.
episodes.title: The Gang Wrestles for the Troops

episodes.description: The gang decides to expand their business by developing a number of products that they could sell at Paddy's pub.
episodes.title: Paddy's Pub: Home of the Original Kitten Mittens

episodes.description: Mac and Dennis decide that they need to spend some time away from each other. Meanwhile, Charlie helps Dee search for her cat.
episodes.title: Mac and Dennis Break Up

episodes.description: Dennis reveals his foolproof system for seducing any woman to the rest of the gang, but they don't grasp the concept.
episodes.title: The D.E.N.N.I.S. System

episodes.description: When Dee gets a part in the new M. Night Shyamalan film, Mac and Charlie seize a chance to pitch their movie script.
episodes.title: Mac and Charlie Write a Movie

episodes.description: After being banned for 10 years from a local drinking competition appropriately named "Flipadelphia," the gang tries to reignite their old rivalry with another local bar. Finding that they are in need of some serious practice, the guys head to Dennis' old fraternity house at the University of Pennsylvania to get their game up to speed while Dee hones her skills on her own. Frank wears skinny pants.
episodes.title: The Gang Reignites the Rivalry

episodes.description: Mac defends traditional marriage, while the rest of the gang reaps the rewards of wedded bliss.
episodes.title: Mac Fights Gay Marriage

episodes.description: Marital bliss turns into business, as the gang experiences the emotional and economic hardships of divorce.
episodes.title: Dennis Gets Divorced

episodes.description: The gang attempts to find adventure on the sea after they purchase their 'new' boat.
episodes.title: The Gang Buys a Boat

episodes.description: Mac finally gets his big break after correctly answering a trivia question on the radio. While Frank, Dennis, and Dee take their bar-banter to the internet with their own podcast.
episodes.title: Mac's Big Break

episodes.description: Rejected from a pool club, Mac and Charlie set out fix an abandoned pool to help cope with the Philly heat wave. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee go about dealing with the heat in a different way.
episodes.title: Mac and Charlie: White Trash

episodes.description: Mac's mother is left homeless after she burns down her house, which leaves Charlie and Mac with no choice but to make new living arrangements; when Dee feels under the weather, Frank tries to muster his paternal instincts to care for her.
episodes.title: Mac's Mom Burns Her House Down

episodes.description: The gang gets a real scare after Dee reveals she's pregnant, forcing the guys to recall their last hazy Halloween party to determine who the father is.
episodes.title: Who Got Dee Pregnant

episodes.description: A blast from the past prompts the guys to expand membership, and Dee to re-consider her future.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets a New Member

episodes.description: Motivated by the drama teacher who inspired her, Dee takes a job as a substitute teacher, and exposes her students to the culture of Paddy's with a field trip to see the Gang's take on the Lethal Weapon series: Lethal Weapon 5.
episodes.title: Dee Reynolds: Shaping America's Youth

episodes.description: Keeping the basement rodent-free drives Charlie to the brink. The gang throws Charlie a surprise party.
episodes.title: Charlie Kelly: King of the Rats

episodes.description: En route to Atlantic City for a charity event, Mac, Frank and Dee get lost. Meanwhile, Dennis and Charlie hitch a ride to town.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Stranded in the Woods

episodes.description: Dee's blessed event is fast approaching but the father's identity remains a mystery---to the gang, at least. So they throw a party and invite all of Dee's former flings.
episodes.title: Dee Gives Birth

episodes.description: After years of being mistreated by Frank during the holiday season, Dennis and Dee decide to teach him a lesson. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie reflect on their childhood Christmases, and realize that they were not as joyous and wonderful as they remembered.
episodes.title: A Very Sunny Christmas

episodes.description: With Frank intent on marrying a prostitute, The Gang tries to make the best of it by attempting an image makeover to uncover the heart of gold that exists deep inside Frank’s “pretty woman.”
episodes.title: Frank's Pretty Woman

episodes.description: Dee and Dennis take the gang to their favorite childhood vacation spot where things aren't quite how they remember. While Dee and Dennis see the seedy side of the Jersey Shore, Mac, Frank and Charlie have the nights of their lives.
episodes.title: The Gang Goes to the Jersey Shore

episodes.description: Frank finds himself in the child beauty-pageant business and fears that people might think that he's in it for the wrong reasons. Meanwhile, Dee wages war on stage moms, and Mac, Dennis and Charlie think they have found a contestant to back.
episodes.title: Frank Reynolds' Little Beauties

episodes.description: Dee faces an IRS audit over her claim that the baby she carried as a surrogate is her dependent, while the guys decide to run the bar in an unemotional, democratic manner rather than their typical method of shouting and personal attacks.
episodes.title: Sweet Dee Gets Audited

episodes.description: When Frank's long lost brother Gino shows up at the bar, the two of them tell the gang about the jazz club they ran in the 1960s and 70s, and how they fell out over Shadynasty, a singer who was the love of both of their lives.
episodes.title: Frank's Brother

episodes.description: As a hurricane threatens Philadelphia, Mac, Dennis and Charlie go to a mall to buy supplies and check out the large breasted TV reporter broadcasting from there, while Frank and Dee prepare Paddy's, and its basement bunker, for the storm.
episodes.title: The Storm of the Century

episodes.description: The gang plays the most twisted board game ever. Dee and Dennis face Mac, Charlie and Frank.
episodes.title: Chardee MacDennis: The Game of Games

episodes.description: The gang uses the Internet to cyber-stalk their prey. Frank tries to drum up business for Paddy's with a viral video.
episodes.title: The ANTI-Social Network

episodes.description: The Gang's plan to "extract" an "artifact" from a residence is jeopardized when the owners turn out to be home. Having not been noticed on the way in, they must make a plan to get the same result for the way out.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Trapped

episodes.description: Step inside the confession booth with Mac as he tells a befuddled priest why his fatness is the fault of the other members of The Gang.
episodes.title: How Mac Got Fat

episodes.description: Traffic problems as a result of the President's visit to Philadelphia makes it difficult for the gang to see the summer's biggest film, "Thunder Gun Express".
episodes.title: Thunder Gun Express

episodes.description: The gang have much to prove when they attend their high-school reunion. They meet old friends and make new foes as they stroll down memory lane.
episodes.title: The High School Reunion (1)

episodes.description: The gang come up with a new plan to buff their tarnished high-school reputations at their reunion.
episodes.title: The High School Reunion Part 2: The Gang's Revenge (2)

episodes.description: Dennis and Dee's ailing grandfather Pop-Pop is wasting away in the hospital, and they have to decide whether or not to pull the plug. But things get complicated when The Gang learns of Pop-Pop's history as a Nazi, and Mac, Charlie and Frank set off in search of the old man's spoils from the war.
episodes.title: Pop-Pop: The Final Solution

episodes.description: With the garbage men of Philadelphia on strike, Frank concocts a plan to undercut the union and get the contract to collect the city's trash.
episodes.title: The Gang Recycles Their Trash

episodes.description: The gang make a disturbing discovery after crashing Maureen's wedding.
episodes.title: The Maureen Ponderosa Wedding Massacre

episodes.description: Charlie and Dee become romantically involved with two members of a wealthy family, which arouses jealousy in Mac, Dennis and Frank.
episodes.title: Charlie and Dee Find Love

episodes.description: The Gang gets Freudian as they step into the therapist's office to work through their mountain of issues, but when Dennis thinks he has everyone figured out, the shrink turns the tables on him and exposes the insanity in his unique brand of pop psychology.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Analyzed

episodes.description: Mac, Charlie and Dee struggle with their faith as Charlie's mom fights cancer. Meanwhile, Frank loses his memory amidst a search for buried treasure.
episodes.title: Charlie's Mom Has Cancer

episodes.description: With Charlie under his wing, Frank cleans up so he can get his hands dirty and help out his old company with one last big merger. An unwritten rule of the bar gets the rest of the gang caught up in a case of mistaken identity.
episodes.title: Frank's Back in Business

episodes.description: After slipping into an unhealthy obsession with computer games, The Gang wrestles to define the difference between the real and the virtual worlds.
episodes.title: Charlie Rules the World

episodes.description: Every member of The Gang has something to celebrate at Guigino's, Philly's finest eatery, but when Mac and Dennis' private dinner is interrupted by an unexpected sighting of Frank and Charlie, the in-fighting begins. Dee also turns up at a table for one, and over the course of the night, the "one-ups-manship" soars to new heights.
episodes.title: The Gang Dines Out

episodes.description: Court is in session at Paddy's Pub as Frank and Dennis present their cases to the rest of the gang, resulting in a verdict that will change their lives FOREVER... but not really.
episodes.title: Reynolds vs. Reynolds: The Cereal Defense

episodes.description: The gang attempts to cheer up a deeply depressed Dee, realizing they are the cause for her predicament.
episodes.title: The Gang Broke Dee

episodes.description: After Frank appears on Local Television advocating gun ownership, the rest of the gang takes a look at the ownership process and alternatives to find a common ground on this still heated issue.
episodes.title: Gun Fever Too: Still Hot

episodes.description: Tired of failing to be recognized for their years of service in the bar industry, the gang changes their ways to give the patrons what they think they want.
episodes.title: The Gang Tries Desperately to Win an Award

episodes.description: The gang does their best to recoup their investments in questionable schemes by dumping their losses on Ben the soldier while trying to avoid being duped again by whatever mastermind is pulling their strings.
episodes.title: Mac and Dennis Buy a Timeshare

episodes.description: Everyone in the gang gets a day to do what they want while everyone else in the gang must participate willingly. This is Mac's Day... and its got twice the "Mac".
episodes.title: Mac Day

episodes.description: A routine trip to a convenience store places the gang in the middle of an armed robbery.
episodes.title: The Gang Saves the Day

episodes.description: The gang voluntarily quarantine themselves inside of Paddy's in an attempt to keep their singing voices pristine for an upcoming competition when a severe flu outbreak sweeps Philadelphia.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Quarantined

episodes.description: When an experiment successfully multiplies Charlie's intellect and takes him away from the bar, the rest of the gang find themselves struggling to complete the menial "Charlie Work" that has kept the bar running for so long.
episodes.title: Flowers for Charlie

episodes.description: After creative differences over what constitutes tasteful nudity cause Frank to pull his money out of "Lethal Weapon 6" during filming, Mac, Dennis, and Charlie screen their rough footage for investors in hopes of raising enough capital to finish the production of their latest masterpiece.
episodes.title: The Gang Makes Lethal Weapon 6

episodes.description: When some bad blood with old foes compromises their ideal Thanksgiving, the gang decides to make amends by breaking bread with those they've hurt.
episodes.title: The Gang Squashes Their Beefs

episodes.description: Mac oversees the gang while they compete to break Wade Boggs’ legendary beer drinking record.
episodes.title: The Gang Beats Boggs

episodes.description: The gang gets into the online dating scene to expand their matchmaking potential.
episodes.title: The Gang Group Dates

episodes.description: When Psycho Pete, long lost member of the freight train, is released from the mental hospital, Dennis and Dee rush to get him recommitted while Charlie and Mac attempt to restore him to his former hard-partying form.
episodes.title: Psycho Pete Returns

episodes.description: Charlie goes into overdrive when he's notified that the health inspector will be arriving that day. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang is trying to exploit a flaw in the air-miles reward system. Written by David Hornsby; directed by Matt Shakman.
episodes.title: Charlie Work

episodes.description: Dennis and Mac enlist Dee to spy on the fish factory across the street, Charlie and Frank grow suspicious and decide to do some spying of their own. Written by David Hornsby; directed by Matt Shakman.
episodes.title: The Gang Spies Like U.S.

episodes.description: The group separates from one another to find out who they are as individuals after another failed endeavor.
episodes.title: The Gang Misses the Boat

episodes.description: News surfaces about Mac's Dad, Luther, being a murder suspect. Mac goes into full "P.I." mode to clear his father of any wrong doing.
episodes.title: Mac Kills His Dad

episodes.description: When the gang appears on a nationally broadcasted game show, Dennis does his best to keep the gang’s weirdness under wraps.
episodes.title: The Gang Goes on Family Fight

episodes.description: Frank decides to retire; the foursome begin to plot and plan ways for each of them to take control of the bar.
episodes.title: Frank Retires

episodes.description: "Asskickers" isn't just a hot new way to work out; it's a way of life...and maybe a cult.
episodes.title: Ass Kickers United: Mac and Charlie Join a Cult

episodes.description: The gang agrees to a truce while demonstrating Chardee MacDennis for an interested board game executive, but the nature of the game quickly sends things off the rails
episodes.title: Chardee MacDennis 2: Electric Boogaloo

episodes.description: Frank falls out the window causing him to think it's 2006, the gang approaches it as a do-over and attempts to fix their past mistakes.
episodes.title: Frank Falls Out the Window

episodes.description: Dennis and Frank square off against Dee and Mac for control of the mountain, while Charlie learns that the slopes have their own set of rules.
episodes.title: The Gang Hits the Slopes

episodes.description: Dennis and Dee film an adaptation of Dennis' erotic memoirs while Frank and Mac try to pass off Charlie as a gifted artist for financial gain.
episodes.title: Dee Made a Smut Film

episodes.description: Mac and Dennis move to the suburbs for cheaper rent but find it hard to adjust.
episodes.title: Mac & Dennis Move to the Suburbs

episodes.description: The gang have a new scheme and Frank tries to keep up.
episodes.title: Being Frank

episodes.description: Old grievances bubble to the surface when The Lawyer agrees to sue Bill Ponderosa on behalf of the Liam McPoyle and his lost eye.
episodes.title: McPoyle vs. Ponderosa: The Trial of the Century

episodes.description: Dennis tries to create an innovative mobile Paddy's pub experience but runs into trouble when customers refuse to cooperate, while Charlie and Mac attempt to catch a thieving leprechaun.
episodes.title: Charlie Catches a Leprechaun

episodes.description: The gang tries to take a vacation from their usual dynamic by going on a cruise, but old habits die hard.
episodes.title: The Gang Goes to Hell

episodes.description: The gang gets real with one another in the face of death.
episodes.title: The Gang Goes to Hell: Part Two

episodes.description: After an electric heating blanket shorts out while the gang watches the Wiz they look in the mirror and realize they've turned black. They have to figure out how to get back to being themselves by going through all the classic body switch movie shenanigans they encounter.
episodes.title: The Gang Turns Black

episodes.description: The gang takes a trip to a local waterpark. Dennis takes on a protégé. Frank and Charlie are determined to ride every ride. Mac and Dee get stuck in a tube slide.
episodes.title: The Gang Goes to a Water Park

episodes.description: Charlie thinks Mac's mom is holding his mom hostage so the gang installs spy cameras in their house. They discover the moms are quite entertaining once Dennis makes edits to the footage.
episodes.title: Old Lady House: A Situation Comedy

episodes.description: Franks Fluids LLC is in big trouble after a news segment. Dee and Dennis help with the PR nightmare and Charlie and Mac work on a scheme to make Fight Milk the official drink of the UFC.
episodes.title: Wolf Cola: A Public Relations Nightmare

episodes.description: A cat-woman is killed and Dennis becomes the main suspect.
episodes.title: Making Dennis Reynolds a Murderer

episodes.description: The gang fight over a lottery ticket and seek out an arbitrator to decide a rightful owner, who also decides if Frank is a hero or hate monger.
episodes.title: Hero or Hate Crime?

episodes.description: Dee dates a male stripper and tries to prove her worth after learning she's his "rock bottom." Elsewhere: Mac and Frank get sucked into a VR war game, leading Mac to develop a case PTSD.
episodes.title: PTSDee

episodes.description: It’s Valentine’s Day and Paddy’s is packed with customers. Dennis implores the gang to do one day of actual work but everyone else is distracted by a mystery crate Cricket spotted in the alley. Eventually, the gang becomes convinced Dennis really wants them to work on their relationships and everyone shares their grievances without much resolution.
episodes.title: The Gang Tends Bar

episodes.description: We get to see a typical day in Cricket's world and then a possible redemption when his family intervenes. Will Cricket finally move on from the gang, finding love in the process? Will Cricket go from filthy beast to his former self, Matthew Mara?
episodes.title: A Cricket's Tale

episodes.description: Dennis reveals he has a baby after his Wade Boggs layover in North Dakota and the gang try to help him get out of the jam, but their suggestions border on the extreme.
episodes.title: Dennis' Double Life

episodes.description: Meet Cindy, the new, ethnically diverse female member of the gang who can successfully pull off scams. Everything is working until Mac introduces a new member: a life-like sex doll that looks exactly like Dennis.
episodes.title: The Gang Makes Paddy's Great Again

episodes.description: To boost productivity, Dee hires an at-home "Escape Room Experience" service to come to Dennis and Mac's apartment. Will they escape? Who will get the credit? What could go wrong?
episodes.title: The Gang Escapes

episodes.description: To one-up the guys, Dee has organized an "all-female reboot" of the Wade Boggs challenge on a first-of-its-kind, all-female flight headed to L.A. for the women's march.
episodes.title: The Gang Beats Boggs: Ladies Reboot

episodes.description: Paddy's has been put on a list of bars that are sexually hostile to women, and the gang must attend a sexual harassment seminar to get off the list.
episodes.title: Time's Up For The Gang

episodes.description: Dee gets in with a group of cool, rich housewives. Dennis hits it off with some everyday blue-collar bros. Frank struggles to renew his license, and Charlie and Mac deal with a new generation of bicycle bullies.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets New Wheels

episodes.description: Jimmy Buffett is in town and the positive vibes are alive at the bar. But when Mac comes out of the women's bathroom, no one can leave until the bathroom situation is solved.
episodes.title: The Gang Solves The Bathroom Problem

episodes.description: With nothing to do while their phones update to the latest software, the gang decides to reminisce on old times. As everyone misremembers events from their past, the gang's current reality becomes altered.
episodes.title: The Gang Does A Clip Show

episodes.description: It's the weekend of Super Bowl LII from Charlie's perspective. While Charlie searches the back office, Cricket steals the suit leaving Charlie home alone to defend himself.
episodes.title: Charlie's Home Alone

episodes.description: It’s the most important weekend of their lives and Frank has treated the gang and a crew of their ragtag hangers-on with tickets to see the Eagles in the Super Bowl!
episodes.title: The Gang Wins the Big Game

episodes.description: Frank tries to recruit Mac for the gang’s kickass float for the Gay Pride Parade. It dawns on Frank that Mac will never be secure with his sexual identity unless he comes out to his father.
episodes.title: Mac Finds His Pride

episodes.description: Mac concocts a scheme to attract single women to Airbnb Dennis' bedroom, while Frank and Charlie concoct similar plans to attract young, European coeds. But neither ad attracts their intended target.
episodes.title: The Gang Gets Romantic

episodes.description: The Gang finds themselves in the middle of a focus group after a screening of Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool. They are determined to restore glory and traditional American values back into the franchise, even if it involves sabotage.
episodes.title: Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool

episodes.description: The Guys are in the final preparation stage for an unknown scheme when Dee excitedly enters to inform them that today is “Dee Day.” The guys have to do everything she wants without complaint.
episodes.title: Dee Day

episodes.description: Annoyed that the Gang failed to react as he nearly choked to death on an appetizer, Frank decides the Waiter, his savior, is the only person who has his back.
episodes.title: The Gang Chokes

episodes.description: During their trip to the Philadelphia Zoo, Mac sets up a text group chain for The Gang, but confusion sets in and The Gang must learn from the meerkats on how to communicate properly in a group.
episodes.title: The Gang Texts

episodes.description: In the black-and-white noir world of his memory, Charlie navigates the seedy underbelly of Philadelphia as Frank has been "diarrhea poisoned," and it's up to Charlie to clean up the mess.
episodes.title: The Janitor Always Mops Twice

episodes.description: As a record-breaking heat wave overtakes Philly, the Gang plans to profit from global warming by pumping up the A/C so people will congregate at Paddy's and save energy at home.
episodes.title: The Gang Solves Global Warming

episodes.description: Trapped inside Paddy's with a suicide jumper on the roof, the Gang wonders if they should bother intervening with an algorithm of their own - Could he, would he, should we? the second half hour, Dennis and Charlie stand guard at the entrance to their laser tag base waiting to ambush the legendary "Big Mo," but Dennis begins to ponder the reasons they play laser tag and if their pursuit of a victory is worth their effort.
episodes.title: Paddy's Has a Jumper

episodes.description: When a trendy new hair salon opens up right next door to Paddy's, Dennis and Frank go on the offensive to stop women from cutting off their hair. Meanwhile, Mac is reunited with his childhood dog Poppins..
episodes.title: A Woman's Right to Chop

episodes.description: In this spoof of Waiting for Godot, Dennis and Charlie stand guard at their laser tag base waiting to ambush their enemy, Big Mo, but Dennis has doubts about why they play laser tag and whether or not the victory is worth it.
episodes.title: Waiting for Big Mo

episodes.description: The Gang looks back on 2020 to justify their numerous PPE loans. In doing so, it is revealed that they contributed to the chaos of the past political year way more than anyone could have imagined.
episodes.title: 2020: A Year in Review

episodes.description: Upon discovering that their self-made Lethal Weapon sequels have been pulled from the local library, the Gang decides to address their political incorrectness by making another film — Lethal Weapon 7.
episodes.title: The Gang Makes Lethal Weapon 7

episodes.description: In the past, an innocent Dennis learns the horrifying details of Frank's business, a truly sweet Dee is excited to head off for Hollywood, while Charlie and Mac's jobs at the roller rink are in jeopardy.
episodes.title: The Gang Buys a Roller Rink

episodes.description: When the Gang suspects Dee is menopausal, they scramble to find a new employee for Paddy's Pub. Dee decides to put her acting career on hold in order to mentor young actors.
episodes.title: The Gang Replaces Dee With a Monkey

episodes.description: The gang's in Dublin where Dennis ends up helping Frank with some of his business's dirty work. Mac and Charlie learn about their Irish heritage. Dee rushes to the set of an Irish soap opera, where she will play an "Obnoxious American MILF."
episodes.title: The Gang Goes to Ireland

episodes.description: Dennis and Dee explore their new accommodations in the countryside. Frank accompanies Charlie to find the truth about Charlie's Irish childhood pen pal. Mac has an identity crisis and decides to join the seminary.
episodes.title: The Gang's Still in Ireland

episodes.description: Mac spends a day at the seminary to truly understand what it takes to become a priest. Dennis and Frank plan an elaborate trap to humiliate Charlie's pen pal. Dee prepares for a date with an Irish doctor. Charlie bonds with his pen pal.
episodes.title: Dee Sinks in a Bog

episodes.description: The Gang attempts to ascend a mountain in order for Charlie to fulfill an old and mysterious Irish burial tradition. One by one, the Gang backs out until Charlie is left to honor the dead body alone.
episodes.title: The Gang Carries a Corpse Up a Mountain
